title: How to become a freelance writer from home - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s a few different ways to do this, but I know it’s always helpful to have an exact strategy you can follow… So here’s exactly how I did it. Step #1 - Find a specialized part of writing you want to start with One of the biggest problems I see with most freelance writers is that they’re simply too vague. In other words, instead of picking a specialization and standing out that way - they decide to become a generalist… And even though I totally understand the logic, trust me - it actually makes your life harder… As it just gives you more competition (because everybody else is a generalist), so niching down is actually the easiest way to stand out. You could do this in a few different ways… But to give you a few examples, you could: Become a content marketer for certain industries, like:Content marketer for tax firmsContent marketer for health and fitnessContent marketer for dog training companiesEtc, etc, etcFacebook Ads copywriterEmail funnel copywriterSales page copywriterEbook writerCover letter writerAnd on and on and on. The important part is really just picking a specialization, as that’s what will help you stand out (and quickly learn your skill)... Then you can always grow after that. Step #2 - Create a portfolio The next thing you need to do after this, is create a portfolio you can use. This is extremely important as it seems to be the one thing clients want to see, so just create a few items you can share… And the only thing I wanted to mention with this, was just making sure that you create “results” if you’re in a results-based field. In other words, if you start with something that can be measured - like: Facebook AdsLanding pageEmail funnelEtc…Then you’ll want to make sure you do a test run with a personal project of yours, as clients will want to see this. On the other hand, if you do something “cosmetic” - like: Content marketerEbook writerCover letterEtc…Then you can get away with just create an example and sharing it that way (as they’ll just want to see your work). After that, we’ll move onto: Step #3 - Getting clients So there’s a lot of different ways you can get clients anymore, but for me personally… I’ve always been a huge fan of Upwork, the world's largest online workplace, especially to start… And if you wanted to try this method, here’s the 3 main guidelines you’ll want to remember: When writing your cover letter, always start by acknowledging you read their job posting. It doesn’t have to be anything fancy either, just a simple acknowledgement will go along wayAfter that, always make sure you include 1 -2 portfolio items (via link)And lastly, make sure you end with a question…Which brings me to the last thing I should probably mention, and that’s the mindset of a cover letter. The biggest problem I see with most freelancers, is how they think they need to go for the sale right away… When that’s honestly the worst thing you can do. The reason for this is because NOBODY buys from strangers, so when you go for the sale right away - you’re just scaring clients away… And on top of this, when you get them to respond (with a question at the end)... That alone will help you stand out from the crowd and win jobs right away. To give you an example of a cover letter that won me $2K, here you go:  Long story short… Freelance writing really doesn’t have to be that hard. If you simply: Find a nicheCreate a portfolio for that nicheThen follow a proven strategy after that…I guarantee you’ll be able to start making money from freelance writing a lot sooner than you’d think… And trust me when I say that, because I honestly had zero experience (or writing education) when I first started… So I’m pretty sure you can succeed in this as well.
